ClearShot is a powerful camera control app that allows you to remotely control your Android device\'s camera. Use this app to take photos, switch between front and back cameras, and record video—all from your Garmin watch.
ClearShot requires the companion Garmin watch app to function. You can download the Garmin app from the Garmin IQ Store.
Note: Due to Android system restrictions, it is not possible to programmatically trigger the native camera app. ClearShot uses its own camera functionality to capture photos and videos.
Below is a general button layout for watches with five buttons. While some models may have slight variations, the functionality will remain consistent with these principles:
• Button 1: Backlight (device-specific, not part of the app)
• Button 4: Back button (device-specific, not part of the app)

• Button 5 (Action Button): Sends a request with the specified delay (default 0). This triggers the phone to:
 - Capture a photo if in photo mode.
 - Start recording if in video mode.
 - Stop recording if a video is already in progress.
• Hold Button 2: Switches between photo and video mode, then immediately sends an action command with the selected delay.

Example: If the watch displays a 5-second delay and the phone is in camera mode, pressing the action button (Button 5) will capture a photo after 5 seconds. Holding Button 2 will instead start a video recording after the 5-second delay.
